project.description:
Model js - A simple javaScript library for creating the Model part of a MVC application.
https://github.com/dgeorges/modeljs.git

project.author: Daniel Georges

Model.name: Model
Model.description:
Model js - A simple javaScript library for creating the Model part of a MVC application.
https://github.com/dgeorges/modeljs.git

Copyright 2012, Daniel Georges
modeljs is distributed freely under a MIT license

Property.name: Property
Property.description: A Property is a name value pair belonging to a Model.
Property.tagname: used internally by the Model.prototype.createProperty method.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the property

params.name: value
params.description: The Property Value
params.type: [String, Boolean, Number, null, Date, Function, Object]

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent property

params.name: metadata
params.description:
The metadata associated with the property. You can put any metadata you want. However the following keys have special meaning and are reserved for use by the framework.
                        validator - a function to validate if the new value is valid before it is assigned.
                        url - the resource this model should use to get it's value. Resource must return json. *Must be used with refreshRate*
                        refreshRate - the interval used to query the url for changes. must be > 0. minimal value used is 100. -1 indicates to only fetch value once. *Must be used with url*

ArrayProperty.name: ArrayProperty
ArrayProperty.description:
The modeljs Property Object that extends a javaScript Array so that Array function like push,
pop, reverse, etc... can be used while at the same time inherited Property methods. Be
aware instances will return false to native Array.isArray() function. THe alternative is
to use Model.isArray() or Array.isArray(instance.getValue()). The former is recommended.

Model.name: Model
Model.description: The model Object that wraps the JSON.

params.name: json?
params.description: The json object to be modeled.

params.name: metadata?
params.description:
May contain the following:
                        name - name of the Model, defaults to "root"
                        *plus any properties accepted by the createProperty method metadata argument or
                         additional data you want stored in the metadata.

classitems.description: Gets the value of the property.
classitems.name: getValue

return.description: The value of the property

classitems.name: getFormattedValue

return.description: The formatted Value

classitems.description:
The fully qualified name of this. The name is calculated by concatenating the name
of the parent, "/", and name of this AKA the shortName. To create a named root pass in the name option key
to the Model Constructor.
example: defaultModel.getName(); // returns "/root" defaultModel.property1.getName(); // returns "/root/property1" namedRoot.property1.getName(); // returns "/customName/property1" For more examples see: testGetNameMethod
classitems.name: getName

return.description: The fully qualified name of this.

classitems.description: The given name of the property.

return.description: The given name of the property.

classitems.description:
Called to set the value of a property. If the setValue is the same as the current value,
nothing will happen and no change events will be fired. If the value is different it must pass
the validator if there is one.  If it does pass the validator and the value is changed, all registered
listeners will be notified unless the suppressNotifications option indicates otherwise.
classitems.name: setValue

params.name: newValue
params.description: The Value you want to assign to the Property.
params.type: [String, Boolean, Number, null, Date, Function, Object]

params.name: suppressNotifications?
params.description: indicates if listeners should be notified of change.

return.description: this for method chaining.

classitems.description:
Registers a callback function with the change event of this.  When the callback is executed it
will have it's 'this' context bound to this (ie. the property listening to the event). The first argument
will be the property that triggered the event. The final argument be the oldValue before it
was changed.
example: model.onChange(callback, {listenToChildren: true}); //listens to change events on entire model model.property1.onChange(callback) //listen to change on property1 only model.subModel.onChange(callback) //listen to change on subModel only. (ie. via model.subModel.setValue(..)) For more examples see: testOnChangeCallbackWhenSettingToSameValue and testBubbleUpEvents
classitems.name: onChange

params.name: callback
params.description: The function to be called if the value of this changes. The callback function will be passed the following arguments (oldValue, newValue, propertyName)

params.name: listenToChildren?
params.description: Registers the callback with sub property changes as well.

classitems.description:
Removes the property and its children if any from the Model. This will fire the 'destroy' event on this and
the 'childDestroyed' event on the parent.
classitems.name: destroy

params.name: suppressNotifications?
params.description: indicates if listeners should be notified of destroy.

return.description: The deleted Property.

classitems.description: Triggers the given event on this. Passing the optional argument.
classitems.name: trigger

params.name: eventName
params.description: The name of the event.

params.name: ...eventArgs?
params.description: Any number of additional parameters to pass to the registered event callback

return.description: Returns this for Object chaining.

classitems.description:
Registers the given callback with the given events on this. When the callback is executed it
will have it's 'this' context bound to this (ie. the property listening to the event). The first argument
will be the property that triggered the event. In most cases these are the same property,
unless the event is bubbling up the tree. The final argument is optional and varies depending on
event type.
classitems.name: on

params.name: events
params.description: One or more space separated eventNames

params.name: callback
params.description: The function to execute when the given event is triggered

return.description: Returns this for Object chaining.

classitems.description: Removes all instances of the given callback on the given events on this.
classitems.name: off

params.name: events
params.description: One or more space separated eventNames

params.name: callback?
params.description: The function to remove. if not specified all callbacks are removed

return.description: Returns this for Object chaining.

classitems.description: Retrieves the metadata associated with this. The metadata is persisted with the json when you pass true to the toJSON method (eg. this.toJSON(true)). Likewise the metadata will be restored when creating a model from the very same json. Note: the modeljs framework uses the metadata to store attributes associated the properties that is uses. As a result the following keys have special meaning. [validator, Formatter, name, url, refreshRate, isJSONPurl, doNotPersist, doNotPersistValue, thin] For example see: testGetMetadataMethod
classitems.name: getMetadata

return.description: A map of metadata properties associated with this.

classitems.description: Determine if this has a validation function associated with it.
classitems.name: hasValidator

return.description: True if this has a validator associated with it. False otherwise.

classitems.description: Determines if the given value will pass the validation function of this.
classitems.name: validateValue

params.name: value
params.description: A value to test against the validation function if it exists.

return.description: The result of passing value against the validation function if it exists. True otherwise.

classitems.description:
Called to set the value of a ArrayProperty. If the setValue is the same as the current value,
nothing will happen and no change events will be fired. If the value is different it must pass
the validator if there is one.  If it does pass the validator and the value is changed, all registered
listeners will be notified unless the suppressNotifications option indicates otherwise.
classitems.name: setValue

params.name: newValue
params.description: The Value you want to assign to this.

params.name: suppressNotifications?
params.description: indicates if listeners should be notified of change.

return.description: this for method chaining.

classitems.description: Determines if the given value will pass the validation function of this.
classitems.name: validateValue

params.name: value
params.description: A value to test against the validation function if it exists.

return.description: The result of passing value against the validation function if it exists. True otherwise.

classitems.description: Determines if the parameter passed in is an modeljs Array Property.
classitems.name: isArray

params.name: property
params.description: Property to test whether or not it is an Array Property.

return.description: true if the Property is an Array Property, false otherwise

classitems.description: Gets the value associated with the Model. This will be a json Object.
classitems.name: getValue

return.description: The json Object represented by the model

classitems.description:
Called to set the value of a model. If the setValue is the same as the current value,
nothing will happen and no change events will be fired. If the value is different it must pass
the validator if there is one.  If it does pass the validator and the value is changed, all registered
listeners will be notified unless the suppressNotifications option indicates otherwise.
classitems.name: setValue

params.name: newValue
params.description: The Value you want to assign to this.

params.name: suppressNotifications?
params.description: indicates if listeners should be notified of change.

return.description: this for method chaining.

classitems.description: Determines if the given value will pass the validation function of this.
classitems.name: validateValue

params.name: value
params.description: A value to test against the validation function if it exists.

return.description: The result of passing value against the validation function if it exists. True otherwise.

classitems.description:
Creates the property with the given name on this. This will fire the childCreated event on the parent. The
metadata can contain custom keys or any of the special keys below.
classitems.name: createProperty

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the property

params.name: value
params.description: Property value
params.type: [String, Boolean, Number, null, Date, Function, Object]

params.name: metadata?
params.description:
A hash of metadata associated with the property. You can put any metadata you want. However the following keys have special meaning and are reserved for use by the framework.
  • validator {Function} - a function to validate if the new value is valid before it is assigned.
  • Formatter {Function} - a function that takes this.getValue() as input and output the value you want returned by the getFormattedValue function. See the documentation of getFormattedValue for more details.
  • url {String} - the resource this model should use to get it's value. Resource must return json. *Must be used with refreshRate*
  • refreshRate {Number} - the interval used to query the url for changes. must be > 100 or -1. -1 indicates to only fetch value once. *Must be used with url*
  • isJSONPurl {Boolean} - if true will use JSONP to fetch the data. The url provided must have the string "$jsonpCallback" where the jsonp callback function should be inserted.
  • doNotPersist {Boolean} - property will not exist in the json object returned by the toJSON method.
  • doNotPersistValue {Boolean} - will clear the value of the property when toJSON is called. For Object and Array types the value will be and empty object/array. Else it will be undefined. *Note metadata can still be persisted.
  • thin {Boolean} - will create a model property representing this but not model any of it's children properties

params.name: suppressNotifications?
params.description: indicates if listeners should be notified of change.

return.description: Returns this for method chaining

classitems.description:
Clones the Model rooted at this keeping all metadata that exist, but not keeping any event listeners.
The name of all properties are adjusted to reflect it's new root.
example: var newModel = model.clone(); // clone root model var clonedSubModel = model.subModel.clone(); // clone subModel For more examples: testModelClone
classitems.name: clone

return.description: Returns a new Model object rooted at this, keeping any metadata but no event listeners.

classitems.description:
Preforms the merge operation on this. The merge operation will add properties that exist in the merged object
but not in this, remove those that are not found in the merged object (unless keepOldProperties is set to true)
and will call setValue for those that exist in both. Note the operation will log an error to the console, return
false, and not modify the object if any of the setValue operation are not valid. Not valid set operations included
those that try to set a value from a property to a model and vise versa.
classitems.name: merge

params.name: json
params.description: The json object to have merged.

params.name: keepOldProperties?
params.description: True if you want to keep properties that exist in this but not in the passed in json, Otherwise they will be deleted. Defaults to false.

params.name: suppressNotifications?
params.description: indicates if listeners should be notified of change.

return.description: Returns true if merge was successful, false otherwise.

classitems.description:
Retrieves the json representation of this. This json representation can be used in the Model Constructor
to recreate the same Model object. If you use includeMetaData validator metadata will be included.
Properties that have the doNotPersist flag in it's metadata will have it's value nullified. This means
properties will have the value set to 'undefined' while models will be set to an empty object ({}).
classitems.name: toJSON

params.name: includeMetaData?
params.description: indicates if model meta data should be included in the returned JSON. Defaults to false.

return.description: The json representation of the Model.

classitems.description:
A global formatter used to calculate the formatted value of a Property. If defined the function
will be called when getFormattedValue gets called. The function should accept the value to be formatted
as the first argument and expect 'this' to be the Property. The formatter must be able to handle any
input type as a value.
classitems.name: Formatter
classitems.type: {Function} A format function whose first argument is the value to be formatted

return.description: The formatted result

classitems.description:
If logging is enabled any warning or incorrect uses of the api will result in output to the console
if it exists.
classitems.name: isLoggingEnabled

classitems.description: Searches the given model for the property of the given name and returns it.
classitems.name: find

params.name: model
params.description: The model to search.

params.name: propertyName
params.description: The fully qualified name of the property. Equal to the getName() value.

return.description: The model object of the given name, null otherwise.

classitems.description:
Connects two properties together. So that events fired on one are also fired on the other. The options
specifies the type of connection to create.

params.name: a
params.description: The source Property

params.name: b
params.description: The destination Property

params.name: options?
params.description:
A hash of options describing how to connect the two properties. The following option are accepted:
  • eventBlackList {Array} - A array of eventNames that should not be connected between the two Properties, all other event are connected.
  • eventWhiteList {Array} - A array of eventNames that should be connected between the two Properties, all other events not connected.
  • includeChildred {boolean} - Indicates if we should connect all the children of source Property as well. The default is false.
  • mapFunction {function} - A function that will map PropertyNames in 'a' to propertyNames in 'b' that should be connected. If the function returns null, the property won't be connected to anything. *This option must be used in conjunction with includeChildren=true. If not specified the default behavior is to map all properties via the getName function. Thus only properties with the same name are connected
  • direction {"oneWay"|"dual"} - Specifies how you would like to connect the two Properties. If not specified default is "dual" if not specified.

return.description: The disconnect function. When executed will remove the connection between the properties.

classitems.description:
This function is registered on the ALL event to propagate its events to the
connected property. FYI 'this' is bound to the source linked property.

params.name: isAtoB
params.description: [description]

params.name: property
params.description: On any event the first argument is the property the event was triggered on.

return.description: [description]

classitems.description: Begins a transaction. All events will be put into the queued. To be fired when endTransaction is called.
classitems.name: startTransaction

classitems.description: Ends the current transaction causing all queued up events to be fired according to the global eventOptization settings or the settings passed in if they exist.
example: model.endTransaction(); //uses settings found in Model.TRANSACTION_OPTIONS model.endTransaction({ // override the Model.TRANSACTION_OPTIONS settings for this transaction fireOnlyMostRecentPropertyEvent: false, flattenCallbacks: true, flattenCallbacksByHash: true }) For more examples see: testFlattenCallbacks, testFlattenCallbacksByHash, testModelEndTransactionWithOptions
classitems.name: endTransaction

params.name: options?
params.description: A map of Model.TRANSACTION_OPTIONS options that you want overridden when clearing this transaction queue.

classitems.description: Determines if you are currently in a start/end transaction block.
classitems.name: inTransaction

return.description: True if your in a transaction block, false otherwise.

classitems.description:
The PROPERTY_CHANGE event is triggered only when the value of the property has changed via setValue. When triggered it will bubble up a MODEL_CHANGED event. Listen to this event if you only want to be notified of direct changes to the property and not changes to any of it's children. This is what the onChange(callback, false) does. PROPERTY_CHANGE event callbacks will be called with the following arguments:
  • this = the property listening to the event
  • arg[0] = the property in it's current state
  • arg[1] = the old value.
classitems.name: Event.PROPERTY_CHANGE

classitems.description:
The MODEL_CHANGE event is triggered when the value of any of the property's children have changed. This includes child properties being created or destroyed. When triggered on a property it will bubble the event up it's model tree. The callback will have the following arguments:
  • this = the property listening to the event. (or is registered with the callback)
  • arg[0] = the property that triggered the modelChange
  • arg[1] = the old value.
classitems.name: Event.MODEL_CHANGE

classitems.description:
The CHANGE event is pseudo event equivalent to a PROPERTY_CHANGE and MODEL_CHANGE event. It is the event used when registering a listener using the onChange(callback, true) method. The callback will have the following arguments:
  • this = the property listening to the event
  • arg[0] = the property in it's current state
  • arg[1] = the old value.
classitems.name: Event.CHANGE

classitems.description:
The DESTROY event is triggered when destroy() method called on a property. It than triggers a CHILD_DESTROYED event on it's parent. The callback will have the following arguments:
  • this = the destroyed property
  • arg[0] = the destroyed property
  • arg[1] = the old value.
classitems.name: Event.DESTROY

classitems.description:
The CHILD_CREATED event is triggered when a new property is created. It's triggered on the parent and propagates a MODEL_CHANGE event up the model tree. The callback will have the following arguments:
  • this = the parent property
  • arg[0] = the created property
  • arg[1] = undefined
classitems.name: Event.CHILD_CREATED

classitems.description:
The CHILD_Destroyed event is triggered when a child property is destroyed. It triggered on the parent and propergates a MODEL_CHANGE event up the model tree. The callback will have the following arguments:
  • this = the parent property
  • arg[0] = the destroyed property
  • arg[1] = undefined
classitems.name: Event.CHILD_DESTROYED

classitems.description:
A special pseudo event named "all" that equivalent to listening to all 'real' events. All events are considered 'real' except for the MODEL_CHANGE event which is a special propagation event and the CHANGE event which is a pseudo event. Triggering the ALL event does not fire all event, but fires an event named all which will call all callback registered to the ALL event. The callback will have the following arguments:
  • this = the property listening to the event
  • arg[0-..n-1] = the same arguments passed to the original event
  • arg[n-1] = the original event name
classitems.name: Event.ALL

classitems.description: Only fires the last event of a property during a transaction.
classitems.name: TRANSACTION_OPTIONS.fireOnlyMostRecentPropertyEvent

classitems.description: Will make sure a callback only gets called only once during a transaction. Even if registered with several properties.
classitems.name: TRANSACTION_OPTIONS.flattenCallbacks

classitems.description: Will make sure callbacks identified by .hash only gets called only once during a transaction. Even if registered with several properties.
classitems.name: TRANSACTION_OPTIONS.flattenCallbacksByHash

classitems.description: Will guarantee that no event are fired during a transaction
classitems.name: TRANSACTION_OPTIONS.suppressAllEvents

classitems.description: Release control of the global window.Model variable restoring it to its previous value
classitems.name: noConflict

return.description: The window Model variable that was just released.
